model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I went out and got a pizza, and when I got home Journey ate a whole piece by herself!
That's super unfortunate, How do you get Journey to not eat the food?
Journey can open the fridge, maybe I should put a lock on it. Do you have trouble with your dogs getting into food too?
Well fortunately they can't open the fridge just yet! But yea sometimes they manage to get into other stuff, especially when I leave it out! Does Sid try to get into food also?
Sid is far more well behaved then Journey when it comes to food out. The worst Sid can do is escape from his cage once in awhile. How are your dogs doing anyways?
They've been better as I left my previous job so I'm spending more time with them, how do you manage to work full time and still keep those animals happy?
I think working at the zoo so long has helped. Why did you leave your last job. Was that the one you were working in the warehouse? Sorry to hear about your dogs, it can be hard managing older animals.
Yea, that totally makes sense! I just wanted time off to spend with the dogs and look for a better job elsewhere, I'm hoping that I'll be able to get a job outside of a warehouse!
That is understandable. I didn't always think I would end up a zookeeper. Do you have anything in mind?
Well, I really enjoy animals so I might think of applying to work in a zoo aswell! Is it a super busy job?
That sounds like a great idea! You would be surprised how busy it can be. Not every job is high demanding and you don't have to work with all the animals either. Is there anything you don't like to do?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'introduction and work discussion', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss their occupations and introduce their pets.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Hey...how are you? ### Speaker B: Hi there. Good. Just chillin watch a movie kinda lol. ### Speaker A: Nice...what do you do for work? ### Speaker B: I work in ac warehouse. Pulling parts. Part time tho. ### Speaker A: Sounds fun....i work at the zoo as a zoo keeper! I love animals!. ### Speaker B: Wow! What is your favorite animal there? ### Speaker A: I'd have to say the white tiger!. ### Speaker B: Neat. Do yall play music for the tigers? Keep em calm. ### Speaker A: Haha no...can't say that we do....do you have any pets at home? ### Speaker B: Bummer. I was gonna suggest green day punk. I have 2 dogs tho. ### Speaker A: What kind of dogs? I have a pet raccoon named journey and a bearded dragon named sid. ### Speaker B: Whoa. My dogs are terriers. What do ya feed a raccoon? Pizza? ### Speaker A: Haha she does like pizza! Anything she can get her little hands on.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'job satisfaction and potential opportunity', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A offers Speaker B a potential job opportunity at the zoo.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Just penguins. They're sooo cute but you have to watch out because they can get feisty. I love my job so much. I hope you can find small things to enjoy about yours. ### Speaker B: It's very repetitive. At first, it was interesting, but now it's boring. I hope to get a promotion, so I can learn something interesting again. Haha. I'm sure working with animals is an everyday thrill. ### Speaker A: I'd gladly have you help out for a few days if I could! The excrement won't pick itself up, unfortunately. You would get to feed some penguins to make up for that though. ### Speaker B: Haha. That sounds like a lovely time. How do you get the fish smell off of your hands afterwards? ### Speaker A: You don't :### Speaker B: The only thing that gets the grease off is dish soap. Have you ever tried vinegar? I heard it neutralizes a lot of odors. ### Speaker A: How is your job going? Have you thought about doing something you find more fulfilling?  ### Speaker B: To be honest I’m at the end of my tether.... I’m out of here as soon as I have someone decent in hand! ### Speaker A: I can talk to the administration out here at the zoo to see if you'd be able to qualify for an entry level position here if you want! ### Speaker B: Omg... that would be like a dream come true... I’ll take anything at this point and trust me you won’t regret it! Truly appreciate the referral... I feel good just thinking about the possibility:) ### Speaker A: I'll send them an email later today. I can't guarantee the work will be fabulous in any manner, usually the entry level positions start out cleaning enclosures and feeding less dangerous animals. But the pay is pretty decent and usually they'll provide on the job training. If you can get into a full time position they also offer benefits and help to pay for schooling so you can progress in the field more quickly! ### Speaker B: You have no idea how grateful I am for this opportunity! I realize it will be an entry level position and what that means but at this point in my life I just needed to switch lanes and this is the perfect sign. I can’t wait to play some music for the white tiger ...' }(3) {'Related Topics': 'pets and future plans', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B plan a pet play date and discuss taking time off.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: We'll get you there someday, but it took me forever to get to that point in my career. We'll start you out playing music for something a little less "man-eaty" first. lol. Also, I have to deal with the penguins again in a bit, so I think I'll try your tip about using vinegar to get rid of the smell after work! ### Speaker B: Haha... ya I gotta earn that... I get it ;) Let me know how the vinegar works out ... ### Speaker A: You bet! How are your dogs doing? ### Speaker B: They are doing great, thanks! They rock... I mean, they are like Zen mastars... I’ve learned so much from them! I am imagining a house concert at your place with our pets soon after I start working at the zoo! ### Speaker A: I can probably bring out the old guitar for the pets if you'd like, don't even have to wait for when you start. Do you have any free time next week? ### Speaker B: How about Friday?! If that works for you.... it’ll be a blast woof woof! ### Speaker A: Do you think my pet raccoon and your dogs should have a play date? ### Speaker B: I think that would be fantastic! I want them to meet! ### Speaker A: I bet they would have so much fun together.  I wonder if my raccoon would be afraid of your dogs though?  We would have to keep everybody on a leash until we see that they get along. ### Speaker B: Oh maybe! My terriers are quite elderly so theyre very mellow if that helps ### Speaker A: Yes, being older dogs will be much better.  I know some of those younger terriers can have quite a lot of energy.  How goes the job hunt? Have you had any offers yet? ### Speaker B: It's going okay. I'm not really in a rush because I'm planning on leaving my part-time and having a small break between starting a new one ### Speaker A: I would love to take some time off.  I've been working at my job for almost 10 years now, and I've only taken 3 vacations in that whole time.  Do you think you'll take a cruise if you take some time off?' }
```

``` Speaker A Input:
current_dialogue:
I went out and got a pizza, and when I got home Journey ate a whole piece by herself!
That's super unfortunate, How do you get Journey to not eat the food?
Journey can open the fridge, maybe I should put a lock on it. Do you have trouble with your dogs getting into food too?
Well fortunately they can't open the fridge just yet! But yea sometimes they manage to get into other stuff, especially when I leave it out! Does Sid try to get into food also?
Sid is far more well behaved then Journey when it comes to food out. The worst Sid can do is escape from his cage once in awhile. How are your dogs doing anyways?
They've been better as I left my previous job so I'm spending more time with them, how do you manage to work full time and still keep those animals happy?
I think working at the zoo so long has helped. Why did you leave your last job. Was that the one you were working in the warehouse? Sorry to hear about your dogs, it can be hard managing older animals.
Yea, that totally makes sense! I just wanted time off to spend with the dogs and look for a better job elsewhere, I'm hoping that I'll be able to get a job outside of a warehouse!
That is understandable. I didn't always think I would end up a zookeeper. Do you have anything in mind?
Well, I really enjoy animals so I might think of applying to work in a zoo aswell! Is it a super busy job?
That sounds like a great idea! You would be surprised how busy it can be. Not every job is high demanding and you don't have to work with all the animals either. Is there anything you don't like to do?

Speaker A: I went out and got a pizza, and when I got home Journey ate a whole piece by herself! ###Speaker B: That's super unfortunate, How do you get Journey to not eat the food? ###Speaker A: Journey can open the fridge, maybe I should put a lock on it. Does Sid try to get into food also? ###Speaker A: Sid is far more well behaved then Journey when it comes to food out. The worst Sid can do is escape from his cage once in awhile. How are your dogs doing anyways? ###Speaker B: They've been better as I left my previous job so I'm spending more time with them, how do you manage to work full time and still keep those animals happy? ###Speaker A: I think working at the zoo so long has helped. Is there anything you don't like to do? ###

``` Speaker A Input:
speaker: Unknown
raw_prediction: It seems like you are considering applying to work in a zoo, which is a great idea! Working at a zoo can be busy but not all tasks are highly demanding, and you don't have to work with all the animals. Is there any specific task or aspect of working with animals that you are not particularly fond of?
prediction:
OUTPUT
Brief explanation: The MEMORY contains information about past conversations where Speaker A suggests Speaker B for a potential job opportunity at the zoo and mentions experiencing a somewhat repetitive and uninteresting job prior, in line with Speaker B's current situation. Additionally, Speaker A has previously expressed how much they enjoy working with animals at the zoo. This information could be helpful as it adds depth to the conversation about career changes and working with animals that is currently taking place in the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.
Judgement: Yes
